```{r}
TRUE == FALSE
-6 * 14 != 17 - 101

-6 * 5 + 2 >= -10 + 1
```

#### Compare Vectors

```{r}
linkedin = c(16, 9, 13, 5, 2, 17, 14)
facebook = c(17, 9, 16, 5, 3, 13, 14)

linkedin > 15 # Compare each element and return a Boolean
facebook <= 5

linkedin > facebook # Compare between elements, it is necessary that each structure have the same numbers of elements.
```

#### Compare matrices

```{r}

views

views == 13
```

#### The if statement

```{r}
medium = "Facebook"
num_views = 14

if(medium == "Linked"){
  print("Showing Linkedin information")
} else if (medium == "Facebook") {
  print("Showing FAcebook information")
} else {
  print("unkown medium")
}

if (num_views > 15){
  print("You are popular")
} else if(num_views <= 15 & num_views > 10){
  print("Your number of views is average")
} else {

}
```

```{r}
result <- ""
number <- 101

if (number < 10) {
  if (number < 5) {
    result <- "extra small"
  } else {
    result <- "small"
  }
} else if (number < 100) {
  result <- "medium"
} else {
  result <- "large"
}

print(result)
```

#### Write a while loop

```{r}
speed = 64

while (speed > 30) {
  print("Slow down!")
  speed <- speed - 7
}
speed
```

```{r}
speed = 64

while (speed > 30) {
  print(paste("Your speed is", speed))
  if (speed >= 48) {
    print("Slow down big time!")
    speed <- speed - 11
  } else {
    print("Slow down!")
    speed <- speed - 6
  }
}

speed
```

#### Stop the while loop: break

```{r}
speed = 75

while (speed > 30) {
  print(paste("YOur speed is", speed))
  
  if (speed > 80) {
    break
  }
  
  if (speed > 48) {
    print("Slow down bi time!")
    speed <- speed - 11
  } else {
    print("slow down!")
    speed <- speed - 6
  }
}
```

#### Build a while loop from scratch

```{r}
i <- 1

while (i <= 10) {
  print(3*i)
  if ((i*3) %% 8 == 0) {
    break
  }
  i <- i + 1
}
```
